title: What is the biggest single-celled organism? - Murry Gans

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: Its volume increases faster than its surface area.

options.label: C
options.text: Its surface area and volume remain the same.

options.text: Its surface area decreases faster than its volume.

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease the surface area of cells.

options.label: D
options.text: To expel waste from the body.

multiple-choice.question: What is Caulerpa taxifolia?
Why is Caulerpa taxifolia able to grow to 30 centimeters in length?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it has a high surface area to volume ratio.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of a cell having a low surface area to volume ratio?

options.label: C
options.text: The cell will eventually die and disintegrate.

options.label: D
options.text: The cell will remain the same size.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are less likely to die and disintegrate.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are more likely to be infected.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It allows the cell to function like a multicellular organism.

options.label: D
options.text: It allows the cell to be more susceptible to infection.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because they have a low surface area to volume ratio.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are unable to exchange resources and waste products.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are unable to adapt to their environment.

options.text: The algorithm was able to predict with 50% accuracy who developed psychosis and who did not.

options.label: B
options.text: To create a new form of mental health diagnosis based on objective, quantitative, and automated analysis of the words we write and say.

options.label: D
